qas.question: What BYU group is known as one of the best formation ballroom dance teams in the world?
What dance championships have been held at BYU for several years?
How is BYU's collegiate ballroom dance program rated worldwide?
What types of dancing are performed by BYU's The Living Legends?
Who has won the U.S. National Formation Dance Championship every year since 1972?
Who was the first team to win the formation championships in 1982?
Who has the largest dance department in the nation?
Where has the NCDA National DanceSport championships been held?

context: <b4_0><b5_0>The BYU <a0_0>Ballroom Dance Company<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> is known as one of the best formation ballroom dance teams in the world, having won the U.S. National Formation Dance Championship every year since 1982. BYU's Ballroom dance team has won first place in Latin or Standard (or both) many times when they have competed at the Blackpool Dance Festival, and they were the first U.S. team to win the formation championships at the famed British Championships in Blackpool, England in 1972 . The <a1_0>NDCA National DanceSport<a1_0/> championships have been held at <b7_0>BYU<b7_0/> for several years, and BYU holds dozens of ballroom dance classes each semester and is consequently <a2_0>the largest<a2_0/> collegiate ballroom dance program in the world. In addition, BYU has a number of other notable dance teams and programs. These teams include the Theatre Ballet, Contemporary Dance Theatre, Living Legends, and International Folk Dance Ensemble. The Living Legends perform <a3_0>Latin, Native American, and Polynesian<a3_0/> dancing. <b6_0>BYU<b6_0/> boasts one of the largest dance departments in the nation. Many students from all different majors across campus participate in various dance classes each semester.
